Pre-Game Insights: Both teams have won their most recent games while batting second.
Sri Lanka defeated Bangladesh, Afghanistan, and India while batting second in their last three games.
Pakistan appeared to be out of options with only one wicket left and requiring 11 from the last over against Afghanistan but triumphed with two sixes.
The wicket in Dubai has become quicker and simpler to bat on as the competition has progressed.
The spinners will still have some turn, and a par score of between 170-180 is anticipated.
Sri Lanka's team is expected to remain unchanged from their match against Afghanistan to their match against India.
Pakistan is expected to maintain its momentum and pick the same starting lineup despite the temptation to rest some players.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match occurred in Dubai under warm, cloudless evening skies with a temperature reaching 36 degrees early in the game.
In T20Is, Pakistan has a 13-8 win-loss record against Sri Lanka.
Pakistan was defeated 3-0 by Sri Lanka in their most recent T20I series.
Both teams will face off against one another in the competition’s final on Sunday after each team had won two of their first two games.
